alert.note: Alert for Dade; Fannin; Gilmer; Murray; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 20 at 8:37AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...TEMPERATURES DROPPING TO NEAR OR BELOW FREEZING COULD CAUSE PATCHY ICING CONDITIONS IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE NORTHWEST GEORGIA APPALACHIAN PLATEAU AND THE COHUTTA WILDERNESS AREA THURSDAY MORNING... Colder air will be pushing into north Georgia following a cold frontal passage with temperatures near of just below freezing following just behind the backside of a line of rain. Some overlap of the freezing air temperatures and falling precipitation could result in a very brief periods of light freezing rain or freezing drizzle in the higher elevations above 1500 ft above sea level as the system pushes to the south. Regardless if freezing temperatures overlap with falling precipitation, temperatures are expected to fall to near or below freezing in the higher elevations of the Northwest Georgia Appalachian Plateau and areas in the Cohutta Wilderness. With some of these areas receiving up to a quarter of an inch of rainfall, subfreezing temperatures may result in some patchy icing on elevated surfaces, sidewalks, and roadways, especially on bridges and overpasses. While temperatures in the higher elevations are expected to continue dropping throughout the day, elevated wind speeds are expected to evaporate any ice that may form by later this afternoon into the early evening.
